subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Utter/Ado
msgSnippet: ... Well, unstressed ER is not NURSE, because that lexical set (like all save HAPPY, COMMA, and LETTER) applies only to stressed vowels.  ER0 would be LETTER,
messageBody:
Anthony Grahn scripsit:

> > I just CMU, and it lists "around," "arrest,"
> > and "arrive," as starting with an ER sound, the same sound in NURSE. I
> > checked on dictionary.com, and these words do not in fact start with
> > ER, so the CMU is wrong, which means I must do a lot of manual editing
> > here.
>
> But I see too that this fails and it really does look like the fault
> of the CMU. It looks like the CMU is so fiercely rhotic that they did
> not pay attention to these "minor" differences (that or the grad
> student that did the work had a hangover that day)

Well, unstressed ER is not NURSE, because that lexical set
(like all save HAPPY, COMMA, and LETTER) applies only to
stressed vowels. ER0 would be LETTER, whereas ER1 would be
NURSE.

--
John Cowan cowan@... http://ccil.org/~cowan
Assent may be registered by a signature, a handshake, or a click of a computer
mouse transmitted across the invisible ether of the Internet. Formality
is not a requisite; any sign, symbol or action, or even willful inaction,
as long as it is unequivocally referable to the promise, may create a contract.
--Specht v. Netscape
